snippet.textDisplay:
You are welcome!
Capcom will realize their errors when it will be too late for them.
Being a long time fan of Megaman, Devil May Cry, Final Fantasy, Castlevania, Silent Hill, i'm full od sadness for the way Japan is facing the "crisis".
If mediocre to horrible titles like DmC, Final Fantasy XIII-2, Silent Hill Downpour are Japan's answer, i'm afraid to know the question :S

snippet.textDisplay:
Indeed, my friend, indeed.
As an all time fan since Mundus, Trish and Dante united for an awful voice acting, I can't agree more about Ninja Theory being one huge of a shitty producer AND Capcom really killing it's own awesome series.
Seriously... Does everybody in Street Fighter IV take body building pills as their morning breakfast? And why the hell is Resident Evil 5 an action game?

snippet.textDisplay:
If I could ever thank you for saying everything I have noticed (a few added information, actually), so far... THANK. YOU. BROKEN. YAMATO. NOW I KNOW WHY YOU'RE BROKEN, PRETTY AWESOME SWORD! (I'd rather consider Yamato a Kodachi than a Katana, considering it's size on both DMC3SE and DMC4, but anyways...)
Thanks for being SO sincere and bringing the utmost truth of a failed enterprise that wants recognition and money no matter what (not to mention how much Capcom's failing hard recently).

snippet.textDisplay:
If you have been following Ninja Theory at all, you should know why fans are pissed. They are hypocratical in thinking that they have good writing skills, they still struggle with coding a game after making three action-based titles, they have removed any SSSensational skill with obtaining large comboes and let's not get started with the FUCK YOU.

Capcom has become complacent with their franchises, and along with the plenty other messes QA are forced to endorse, it shows.

snippet.textDisplay: Devil May Cry 3 had an excellent soundtrack. Really dig the organ parts, and the break in this one. If I'm not mistaken this song was also featured in one of the first trailers. I remember watching it over and over because it was so well done.

snippet.textDisplay: Nope, my version's the original ("no" difficulty might be a bit of an exaggeration, but certainly by DMC standards it was much easier).

snippet.textDisplay: Dante's weapons were fun for a bit, but it just seemed like he could tear though just about anything he encountered with no difficulty; being able to switch styles on the fly especially put him over the top, imo.  Really, though, the backtracking was the bigger problem.
snippet.textOriginal: Dante's weapons were fun for a bit, but it just seemed like he could tear though just about anything he encountered with no difficulty; being able to switch styles on the fly especially put him over the top, imo.  Really, though, the backtracking was the bigger problem.

snippet.textDisplay: Well... the direction the series is going... I honestly dont like it. The combat was AWESOME as always, its just that it is not Devil may cry. Its not following the old direction of art style or music too much :P Also, it seems that "FUCK YOU!!!!" is the new theme for Devil may cry (also dante seems to shout that a lot in DMC), which dissapointed me a lot.
snippet.textOriginal: Well... the direction the series is going... I honestly dont like it. The combat was AWESOME as always, its just that it is not Devil may cry. snippet.textDisplay: DMC4 is a decent game, though nowhere near as good as 3 or 1.  Nero was surprisingly fun to play as, but the Dante section (between the backtracking and Dante being ridiculously overpowered) kind of puts a damper on the overall game.  Bayonetta, even if the heroine isn't the greatest, is a much better game that's still very DMC-esque (same creator).
snippet.textOriginal: DMC4 is a decent game, though nowhere near as good as 3 or 1.  Nero was surprisingly fun to play as, but the Dante section (between the backtracking and Dante being ridiculously overpowered) kind of puts a damper on the overall game.  Bayonetta, even if the heroine isn't the greatest, is a much better game that's still very DMC-esque (same creator).

snippet.textDisplay:
DMC>DMC3>DMC2>DMC4

I've finished all of them, and that's what I think. Nothing tops the feeling of exploring that eerie castle in DMC 1, but holy shit was DMC 3 insanely cool, even though some parts (guitar weapon lol) were trying too hard.
snippet.textOriginal:
DMC>DMC3>DMC2>DMC4

I've finished all of them, and that's what I think. Nothing tops the feeling of exploring that eerie castle in DMC 1, but holy shit was DMC 3 insanely cool, even though some parts (guitar weapon lol) were trying too hard.

I'm a routined DMC player, and I do not recommend DMC4. I did not like it at all, cuz the fighting is a bit sketchy imo, and tha story just plain strange (and after DMC2, that says a rather lot).
You might like it though, so if you're curious you should give it a shot. Atleast I have warned you about it. xD

snippet.textDisplay: I don't think they'll slip in the gameplay mechanics or any of the "program" part, but the story seems so disappointing, they've sucked out all the soul the game had. Dante turned out into a teenage in and out (dropping fucks and shits like a 14-years old). Can't say much about vergil with the little that they showed, but he seemed so "idealistic" and "good-willing", much different from the original cocky and cold. His clothes are pretty nice though. Prolly will be: a good game, not a good DMC.
snippet.textOriginal: I don't think they'll slip in the gameplay mechanics or any of the "program" part, but the story seems so disappointing, they've sucked out all the soul the game had. Dante turned out into a teenage in and out (dropping fucks and shits like a 14-years old). Can't say much about vergil with the little that they showed, but he seemed so "idealistic" and "good-willing", much different from the original cocky and cold. His clothes are pretty nice though. snippet.textDisplay: I'm usually not a big fan of this kind of music, but with this series it simply works too well. It﻿ makes your heart pump while you're fighting hordes of﻿ monsters with the awesome combat system. I haven't played DMC4 yet, I saw it super cheap. I'm very curious about the DMC reboot, it seems like they made some strange decisions (starting with Dante's teenage look). But I have faith in Ninja Theory.
